item.title: Khim add a quote by Marcus Tullius Cicero
item.description: "A room without books is like a body without a soul." -- Marcus Tullius Cicero

item.title: Khim add a quote by Frank Zappa
item.description: "So many books, so little time." -- Frank Zappa

item.title: Khim add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "I am so clever that sometimes I don't understand a single word of what I am saying." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Khim add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "To be yourself in a world that is constantly trying to make you something else is the greatest accomplishment." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Khim add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "Blessed are the cracked, for they shall let in the light." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: Khim add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "When we lose one blessing, another is often most unexpectedly given in its place." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Khim add a quote by Bob Dylan
item.description: "May God bless and keep you always, May your wishes all come true, May you always do for others And let others do for you. May you build a ladder to the stars And climb on every rung, May you stay forever young," -- Bob Dylan

item.title: Khim add a quote by Thomas Mann
item.description: "A writer is someone for whom writing is more difficult than it is for other people." -- Thomas Mann

item.title: Khim add a quote by William Blake
item.description: "My mother groaned, my father wept, into the dangerous world I leapt." -- William Blake

item.title: Khim add a quote by Katharine Hepburn
item.description: "We are taught you must blame your father, your sisters, your brothers, the school, the teachers - but never blame yourself. It's never your fault. But it's always your fault, because if you wanted to change you're the one who has got to change." -- Katharine Hepburn
